ac.breakdown: Base Armor Class 10, Base Modifier +7, Dexterity +4
ac.name: ac

description.value: Trigger A creature targets the Copper Hand rogue with an attack, and the rogue can see the attacker; Effect The rogue dodges out of the way, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

The rogue applies one of their black adder venom poisons to their wielded weapon. If their next attack with that weapon before the end of their next turn hits and deals damage, the target is afflicted with the poison.
The Copper Hand rogue deals 1d6 additional precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

Adder venom is a simple but effective way to enhance a weapon.

Saving Throw DC 18 Fortitude; Maximum Duration 3 rounds; Stage 1 1d8 poison damage (1 round); Stage 2 1d10 poison damage (1 round); Stage 3 2d6 poison damage (1 round)

Activate D Interact

Sometimes referred to as an alley bow by rogues or ruffians, this small crossbow fires small bolts that are sometimes used to deliver poison to the target. It's small enough to be shot one-handed, but it still requires two hands to load.
A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.
These blades come in a variety of shapes and styles, but they are typically 2 feet long.
